heading: Stoff2D - 2D Game Engine
description: Stoff2D is a 2D game engine/library written in pure C. I developed a deep understanding and appreciation for data structures and algorithms to implement various engine features. There were many challenging moments that stretched my abilities, most notably creating a 2D batch renderer which also facilitates sprite atlasing. Another really interesting thing I learned and implemented was text rendering and font loading. I also implemented a fairly expressive particle system and my own animation file format which allows animations to be defined in a JSON-like style.

heading: Height Perceptions - Virtual Reality Experience
description: Height Perceptions is a 3D virtually reality experience where users can explore a magical toyshop, shrinking to the size of a toy. Developed by myslef and 5 other team-members, a mark of pride we had for this project was an expressive artstyle with completely bespoke assets. In only 13 weeks I worked closely with a fellow artist to produce all the assets for the experience. This project really challenged my ability to learn quickly in a fast paced team invironment.

heading: This Website - PortFolio Website
description: I developed this portfolio website using React and Tailwind. I improved my ability to create intuitive and interesting user interfaces, as well as how to create a maintainable portfolio site which reads project information from a json file to make adding content easy

heading: CGL - 3D Voxel Engine
description: CGL is a 3D voxel engine written in C and uses the OpenGL graphics API. The coolest thing about this project for me was developing all the 3D math myself. Every matrix and vector operation was developed as part of my own math library which followed conventions seen in cglm and glm. I had a blast implementing the greedy mesh algorithm for optimized chunk rendering and testing how effective batch rendering can be when applied to cubes.
